Name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Faster Than Light
Description:
This new additional rules set, Battlestar Galactica – Faster than Light Expansion Pack, enlarges the Battlestar Galactica – Starship Battles game, introducing many optional rules allowing the players to broaden their game experiences and possibilities.

In this pack you will find additional rules for planetoids and clouds, introducing new kinds of planetoids as the orbiting planetoid; all the rules for a spaceship to take–off and land; the use of missiles, expanding the firepower of the spaceships you can play with, both old and new ones, increasing the game options guiding your missiles in a search of enemy targets; and finally Advanced FTL movement rules that allow the players to really jump along the game surface, avoiding opponent attacks and execute deadly surprise attacks on enemy spaceships.

This set includes all game components needed to play with these new rules: new markers, counters, rulers, and a useful navigation panel to assemble to jump through the stars with the new advanced FTL rule.

Jump into your seat and start your engine — there’s a war to win!

-description from publisher's website

On December 29, 2020, Ares games announced that due to end of licensing, this product would only be released as a free PDF.

Name: Cosmopolitan: The Game
Description: Based on the sort of quizzes typically found in Cosmopolitan magazine. Multiple-choice questions (chosen by a spinner) are asked and all players choose their preferred answers on their erasable boards. At the end the players score their answers to produce personality types, and then boards are shuffled and players try to guess who got whioh personality.

Name: Skulls of Sedlec: Castle Guards
Description:
Castle Guards is a 6-card expansion that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.

This expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: the Castle Guards. They want to keep watch over Royals by being above them.

Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play.

Name: Mischief at the Museum
Description:
In the cooperative setup, you take on the role of museum creators, working together to put together a grid of museum rooms for a museum of whatever theme you decide as a group. Picking a theme has no mechanical purpose, but the game encourages light roleplaying, so knowing whether you’re making a bacon or donut museum helps encourage that. Rooms are things like the gift shop, special exhibit, hands-on exhibit, bathroom, etc…

Then you get dealt one of 6 characters: three museum employees (Docent, Janitor, Volunteer) and 3 family members (Grandparent, Parent, Teen). The mechanic involved is age; players and NPC visitors in the museum are either Youth, Adult, or Senior. Of course there are roleplaying opportunities here too.

Then you get dealt Attribute Cards, basically sets to collect by moving around collecting memory tokens (Education, Bonding, Romance, and Mischief). You’ll get to manage your cards by drawing and discarding as the game goes on. It’s played over 7 turns, or the 7 hours the museum is open.

Each turn you have 5 Actions you can do, kept track of by cards you flip over. One Action, the Hour Action, changes each hour to keep things fresh. There are certain conditions that have to be met, involving the number of people in a room and their ages, to collect the memory tokens. The roleplaying charm comes from describing these actions, including what mischievous things you do, as you do them.

At the end you complete the best sets you can with the tokens you’ve collected and add up the points.

-description from designer

Name: Rome & Roll: Gladiators
Description:
While Rome is being rebuilt, the public demands entertainment! Emperor Nero wants you to sponsor games in the Colosseum, where gladiators will engage in thrilling battles for the enjoyment of the crowds. It's up to you to build ludi, where gladiators can be trained in one of the two competing schools, and arenas, where they can practice. You'll then assign the gladiators to the Colosseum to fight! All the excitement has also brought forth new advisors who offer enticing rewards for those who dare to bribe them...

The Rome & Roll: Gladiators expansion introduces a new Colosseum sideboard, gladiator dice, new shared advisors, a neutral foreman, and new blueprints, God's Favour, and Nero's Bonus cards. Gladiators also adds a fifth asymmetric character class — the Rudiarius, a retired gladiator who has earned their freedom. A veteran of the Colosseum, the Rudiarius can call in favors with his old masters to get ahead.

—description from designer

Name: BomBarDum
Description:
Build the tallest tower in the kingdom! In Bombardum you must shoot, build and defend your tower in order to raise the victory flag. Enjoy epic games of destruction, strategy and chaos in this fun card game. The cannons are ready: let the BomBarDum begin. Fire!

In each turn a player plays a card on his tower and shoots, if the card is a cannon, to the tower next to it. To win the game a player has to reach 4 levels of the tower and keep it intact for one whole round.

Name: SpaceShipped: Out of Route
Description:
Political disturbances have driven you to new regions of space, and here, the markets aren't as predictable as in your home sector. Your reputation reached here before you did, however, and gained you some new friends, new opportunities and a new ruthless enemy.

COMPONENTS

     5 Multipurpose cards
     1 Enemy card


SETUP
Set aside the Wealth, Starting Crew, Ship, and Equipment cards from the base game.

Sort the remaining base game cards along with any expansion cards into the following groups: Crew, Ships, Equipment, and Enemies.
Shuffle each group, then randomly draw the following:

     Crew: 3
     Ships: 3
     Equipment: 7
     Enemy: 1


Along with the cards that you set aside, these are the 18 cards you will use to play.


Released in the July 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

Name: Silicon Saga: Wreck of the Andromeda
Description:
Silicon Saga: Wreck of the Andromeda is a sci-fi dungeon crawl/exploration game set aboard the floating wreck of a space research station. Players take on the roles of members of a crew of space marauders looking to strip the station of valuable resources. Unfortunately, the station is not quite as abandoned as they had hoped. They will be faced with lurking dangers and struggling survivors. The goal of the game is to collect a determined amount of silicon from the ship and return to the hanger with the silicon before the game ends. There are variable play modes which allow players to compete against each other or to play cooperatively.

The game is played on square tiles with players drawing and placing tiles as they explore the ship. Players move and interact by playing cards. The game is broken into rounds with each player drawing a number of cards and performing a number of action during the round. Players take turns, performing actions one at a time. They have a chance to add new cards to their deck or hand each round or to gain additional actions.

While exploring the Andromeda, players will find resources such as crafting components, ammo, food and their true goal, silicon. They may also find survivors, dangerous threats or face random events. Interaction with survivors or threats are handled through a chit-pull system. Each player has a bag and a set of different markers, each with a different effect. Throughout the game, the cards they play will have them add markers to their bag to form a pool. When interacting with entities, they can play cards that let them draw markers from the pool in an attempt to cause different effects. Players may face hostile encounters or peaceful encounters. Each marker type has a different effect depending on the type of encounter.

In addition to interacting with entities encountered onboard, players can interact with one another. They can steal from or sabotage other players to take or force them drop any carried silicon.

Silicon Saga can be played by a group or by a single player. For solo play, the game can be played using the base game mode. The rules will also include additional solo player challenges.

Name: The New Game of Sky
Description:
An early 1900s shedding-type card game where the cards are themed around objects in the sky: the sun, moon and stars.

There are four coloured sets, running from 1 to 10 plus quarter moon, half moon, three-quarter moon and full moon in each colour. The yellow nine is replaced by the Sun, which is a special card that can double winnings if played by the winner to “Go out with the Sun”, but doubles the penalty if still held in the hand at the end of a round.

An ante is paid into the winner’s pool by each player at the start of each round, and the dealer also pays into a separate pool for each phase of the moon, and double for the Sun. The top card is turned over each round to select the winning colour for the round, and any player that plays a moon card in the matching colour gets the contents of the matching moon pool. The Sun pool is only emptied when a player goes “Out with the Sun”, when they also get all winnings from all other coins as well.

Name: Buddy Cop
Description:
Buddy Cop is a cooperative card game of blockbuster action for 1-2 players. Set in the same universe as Brook City, Buddy Cop sees players take on the role of heroic cops tasked with bringing down criminal operations in the middle of an intense shootout.

Each round, players are presented with 4 cards, which represent the actions available to a player on their turn. Each card offers 2 options: pay the cost and play the card for its action, or discard the card to gain the resources listed. Players must manage their actions and resources efficiently if they hope to remain in the fight long enough to find the criminal boss and make the arrest.

Buddy Cop offers unparalleled modularity with its different fixed card decks that can be mixed and matched to create custom scenarios. Players first choose a cop to embody, wielding their unique cop deck to make use of their signature skills and abilities. Then, they’ll choose an operation deck, detailing not only the locations where criminal activity is taking place, but also what exactly the criminals are up to and how they win. Lastly, they’ll select a criminal deck to go up against, containing both the criminal mastermind behind the caper, as well as the minions they’ll unleash against our officers.

-description from designer

Name: Jurassic Cats
Description:
A Trick-taking card game fun and quick with dangerous cats and cute dinosaurs. You must try to overcome the chaos of the situation.

There, cats will hunt dinosaurs and try to capture them.
You must attack and adapt.

Each turn you must choose your objectives and try to win them with the meat you have, otherwise you will have nothing.

At the end of the game the winner is the one with the most dinosaurs's points.

Name: Trivia Box: We Love 90s
Description:
It's time for some nostalgic, retro fun with the We Love the 90s Trivia Game! Players have to guess whether statements like "Beavis and Butthead launched on VH1 in 1993" are true or false. The person with the most points once all rounds have finished is declared the winner.

Comes with 100's of trivia questions and 20 picture cards.

Name: Billionaires Money
Description:
A simple and fun game you play with the objective to become the first one to accumulate one billions dollars and hence become a Billionaire.  Collect money by landing on the right slots while avoiding pitfalls that will rob you of your money.

The pitfalls include locations such as “Donation,” “Robbery”, "You Didn't Build That", "Wealth Redistribution", and "Tax The Rich".

Billionaires Money is for 2-10 players ages 14 and up.

It comes with 6 denominations of money up to $1 billion.

The Monopoly-esque board game comes with features such as “Property,” cards that award players with items like a yacht, island, helicopter, luxury car, or fine art, and “Business,” cards that equip players with revenue-generating operations such as a global coffee chain, burger franchise, or beauty supplies store.

Name: Minions of Disruptions: a collaborative climate game for organizations and communities
Description:
Fueled by climate change, millions upon millions of minions are set to disrupt the way we live on Planet Earth: Carbions build up Disruption Scale as our reliance on oil, plastics, and the like grew; Climmies descend to organizations and communities everywhere and causes disruptions to our normal way of working and living. Some of the minions are bound for your organization. These wicked creatures are mischievous and unpredictable, The only way to bring the minions under control is to activate Zillians, the resilience superheros who provide the ultimate resilience any organization can wish for a sustainable future.

In Minions of Disruptions, you and your fellow players are colleagues from the same organization or neighbors from the same community to combat climate minions. You must work hard and smart together to activate resilience superheros, Zillians, before the two types of minions, carbions and climmies, take over with their disruptions.

Minions of Disruptions is designed to be played by multiple teams, and can also be played standalone by one single team.

—description from the designer

Visit website: dayad.org/game-day for more information!

Name: Street Masters: Rumble Pack
Description:
A new, Blacklist Games exclusive pack that contains:

1 Sticker Sheet (new faction logos, as well as any logos that were not in the Aftershock box)
12 New Ally/Rivals + Tokens
3 Classic GenCon Promo Ally/Rivals + Tokens
2 New Showdown Decks (The Oni & The Nahualli)
15 Plastic Dividers (for Tide of the Dragon content & New Challengers Pack content, usable in the Aftershock collector's box)

Name: The Little Flower Shop: Employee Pack
Description:
Send your employee to the warehouse to grab what you need for your window display! The Employee Pack is a brand new expansion  containing 10 "employee" cards and 2 rule cards. At the start of the game, remove 10 random shop cards and replace them with the 10 employee cards.  With the 10 removed cards, flip 4 of them to make the "warehouse." At the end of each round, players who kept employee cards during the round can now discard them to take a card from the warehouse (and flip a new one to replace the chosen one).  If multiple players have employee cards, they take turns in order on the cards - so watch out that someone else doesn't take the card you were eyeing!

-description from kickstarter

Name: GLADIATOR: Fight To The Finish
Description:
Fast-action card game for 2 players, designed to simulate the deadly dance of fighting with sword and shield.

The mechanics seek to solve the problem of realistically capturing the flow of gladiator combat without getting bogged down in lots of charts and dice throws.

Players draw a hand of 9 cards from their own deck and alternate playing attacks, feints, blocks and maneuvers, hoping to catch their opponent with his guard down.

Wounds reduce the size of subsequent hands drawn.  The game ends when one player is reduced to zero (killed) – or has stopped the game to plea for his life.

Gladiators may be named and tracked for on-going campaigns or tournament play.

-description from designer

Name: Monopoly: Stirling Edition
Description:
The world's favourite family board game brings you another exciting Monopoly: Stirling Edition.

Choose your favourite token, tour the beautiful sights of Stirling, including Stirling Castle and The National Wallace Monument, and accumulate fortunes, but watch out for taxes, jail and bankruptcy.

You owe rent or reap the rewards?

Invest in houses and hotels and trade your way to success.

Monopoly, the great property trading board game finds its home in the vibrant Scottish city of Stirling: a city steeped in history yet offering a host of modern day attractions. Journey around the gameboard and explore landmarks including: The Church of the Holy Rude, Dunblane Cathedral and The King's Knot. Don't forget to stop off for some refreshments en route at The Birds and The Bees or Blairmains Farm Shop & Coffee Bothy. You can further relax with a spa date at The Stirling Highland Hotel or take in some art at the Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum.

Name: Bibellinjen
Description:
Bibellinjen (Bible line) is a simple game which focuses on learning the order of the books of the Bible. It is fast paced, simple to learn and fun for all ages. The game comes with four different variants makes it a suitable match for different age groups and will work well with Sunday schools, youth groups and other Bible oriented contexts.

The first edition is published in Swedish in November 2020. If there is interest it may be translated in to other languages as well.

Bibellinjen is inspired by the game Time line by Frédéric Henry.

Gameplay (standard rules):
Players try to collect points by gaining cards. When it is your turn you deal five cards and place them face up in front of you. You should then try to rearrange the cards so they are placed in the same order that they appear in the Bible. Each card has the name of a Bible book on one side and on the other side there is a number that indicates what order that book has in the Bible. By flipping the cards you can see if the order you settled for is correct or not. If all cards are not in the right order you must remove cards from the sequence until a correct sequence remains. Once that is done you may keep any cards still in front of you. The other cards are discarded to a discard pile which is shuffled into the draw deck when it runs out. The game ends when there are not enough cards in the draw pile to finish the round. The player who collected the most cards is the winner.

—description from the designer

Bibellinjen är ett enkelt spel som går ut på att lära sig ordningen på Bibelns böcker. Det går snabbt att spela, är lätt att lära sig och är roligt för alla åldrar. Med fyra olika varianter för olika åldersgrupper passar det utmärkt till såväl ­konfirmandgrupper som söndagsskolor och andra bibelorienterade sammanhang.

—description from the designer (Swedish)

Name: Safecracker
Description:
Safecracker is a simple deduction game played with a standard deck of cards.

To setup, remove all 10s, jacks, queens, and kings from the deck. These cards will not be used. One card in each suit is removed. These cards make up the combination to the safe. The other cards are dealt out to the players. Some may get more than others.

The player with the fewest cards goes first. On a turn, a player asks about a possible combination, i.e. one card from each suit. All other players must announce how many of those cards they have and then show these cards to the active player. At any time, a player may say "stop!" and check to see if they have the right combination.

Optional rules to make the game easier allow calling a specific suit, in which case each player must show you one card of that suit, or, instead, a suit and a player, in which case that player must announce how many cards they have in that suit and then show you all of them.

Name: Dossier
Description:
Dossier is a head to head spy game of stealth and deduction
Dossier (daa·see·ei) is a head to head game where you play as a spy trying to collect intel. The first player to collect 3 case of intel or successfully assassinate the enemy spy to win.

There are 16 spy cards laid out face up (in a 4x4 grid), there are 5 intel brief cases spread out between them.  Each player is given a card (facedown) that matches one of the 16 cards in front of both players.  These are their spies for this game.  Each player takes turns moving through the crowd, collecting intel briefcases and trying to deduce who their counterpart's spy is.  The first player to either collect 3 briefcases or successfully assassinate their opponent wins.

This is a mint tin game, with simple to teach rules, quick games, where the more you play, the deeper the strategy gets.

On your turn, you can complete 1 of 3 actions.

1. Switch ANY two adjacent spy cards on the grid. Your spy does not have to be either of the two spies that are switched.

2. Pick Up Intel: If your spy is next to an intel briefcase, you can pick it up & place it in front of you. Be aware that now the other player can deduce that you are 1 of the 4 spies next to the Intel Briefcase.

3. Assassinate: If you are confident that you know who the enemy player’s spy is, you can attempt to assassinate them. To do this, you simply announce that you want to attempt to assassinate a spy. Pull the card from the grid you want to assassinate. The enemy player then reveals their facedown Green Falcon Card. If it is a match you win! If it is not a match, your assassination failed and you lose the game. So be sure that you know who they are before assassinating them!

Name: El Joc de Valencià
Description:
El Joc de Valencià is a board game in which the city of Valencia, its most emblematic monuments and shops are the protagonists.

El Joc de Valencià is a game for the whole family with rules between Monopoly and The Game of the Goose .

With El Joc de Valencià you can buy monuments such as Micalet, Mercat Central or shops like Alvaro Moliner, Espai Ripalda, Trufas Martínez, Casa Montaña ... or become the master of the city by acquiring the Oceanogràfic or the Bioparc.

A nice way to get to know the city of Valencia.

Name: One-Dimensional Chess
Description:
Doc Pop's One-Dimensional Chess is a chess variant that puts a new spin on the classic game of chess. The board consists of 16 squares in one row. Each of the two players have a pawn, a knight, a bishop, a rook, a queen, and a king.

The pieces have modified rules that allow them to move in one-dimension. For instance, knights can jump 2 or 3 tiles from where they started. Bishops travel along every other tile, ignoring any pieces on squares of a different color than the one they currently occupy.

By breaking chess down into one single row, players may find themselves visualizing moves a little further in advance than they could in a normal game of chess.

Doc Pop's One-Dimensional Chess started off as an experiment, but after years of testing and feedback, it's turned into a highly enjoyable strategy game worth checking out.

—description from the designer

Name: The Clash of Elephants, the Battle of Raphia 217 BC
Description: "The Clash of Elephants, the Battle of Raphia 217 BC" is a free Print & Play wargame simulating the battle fought near modern Rafah between the forces of Ptolemy IV Philopator, king and pharaoh of Ptolemaic Egypt and Antiochus III the Great of the Seleucid Empire during the Syrian Wars. It was one of the largest battles of the Hellenistic kingdoms and was one of the largest battles of the ancient world. In the game, the Players command the actual forces available to the historical army commanders.
Families: History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Long Road: Ancora più Lontano
Description: Very small expansion for the base game "The Long Road". It gives each player a power that can be used during his turn.

Name: Ducks in Tow: The Angry Goose Mini-Expansion
Description:
The angry goose is scaring away the ducks! Even you're afraid to go near him! Help your duck friends to stay away from the angry goose.

The Angry Goose mini expansions adds a new level of strategy for players looking for a deeper level of spatial puzzle solving.

Score 2 bonus points per Goose Icon if there are no ducks to the left AND to the right of the goose. You can also have geese next to each other. Scaring ducks is a group activity after all!

You don't score any bonus points if there is a duck next to the goose or if there is a missing card on either side of the goose!

Name: Regicida
Description:
In Regicida (Kingslayer), each player secretly represents a House and tries to position his allies without raising suspicious.

The Objective of the game could be: position your Allies in the center of the board, in the border of the board, forming the largest cluster as possible or have the most allies afar from each other. Only one is chosen during the Setup.

The game is divided in four phases, performed in the following order: Expansion, Intrigue, Coronation, and Assassination. During the Expansion Phase the players place Ally Tiles to create a 6x6 grid. During the Intrigue Phase, the players can swap positions of Ally Tiles to enhance the position of their Allies. In the Coronation Phase the Houses gain points, according to the Objective, and the Ruling House is the House with the most points. Then, in the Assassination Phase, the players votes to eliminate the player who they think owns the Regent House.

The game ends right after the Assassination Phase and the winner is the player that represents the Ruling House, in case the assassination failed; or the player that represents the House with most points among the assassins.

—description from the designer

Name: カメレオンの定義 (Definition of a Chameleon)
Description:
ã‚«ãƒ¡ãƒ¬ã‚ªãƒ³ã®å®šç¾© (Kamereon no teigi) Definition of a Chameleon is a free PnP game from Japan.

It was a dark and stormy night. We had gathered at the pub in South End Station and held a welcome party for Harris, my best friend. Olivia, who up until now was only into drinking her scotch, called out, "Hey everyone, how about playing a card game?".

I wondered whether or not we'd be able to keep up with the ever changing rules of the game -- like a Chameleon.

At the beginning of the game, the way points are scored is undefined. But as the game goes on, you will gradually find out how to score points through the cards you play. Because of this, each game will play out differently.
publisher's summary

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – TIE/rb Heavy Expansion Pack
Description:
The TIE/rb Heavy is one of the largest TIE variants produced for the Galactic Empire and is often assigned to patrol routes where it is expected to fight without the support of a carrier or escorts. Thanks to its robust armor, swiveling laser cannons, and integrated MGK-300-series droid intelligence, this vessel lives up to its nickname: the "Brute."

The TIE/rb Heavy Expansion Pack includes everything you need to add one of these imposing ships to your Galactic Empire squadrons, beginning with a beautifully detailed, pre-painted miniature and a medium plastic base. Four ship cards give you the freedom to choose your pilot, while 12 upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fir your needs. Finally, two Quick Build cards offer helpful combinations of pilots and upgrades to get you into the fight right away.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Heralds of Hope Squadron Pack
Description:
The spark of hope has ignited! The Resistance rises to meet the First Order in one final confrontation to determine the fate of the galaxy. Taking flight in T-70 X-wing and RZ-2 A-wing starfighters, new pilots join the cause, fighting alongside Resistance heroes like Temmin “Snap” Wexley as they seek to break the First Order’s tyrannical hold on the galaxy.

This Squadron Pack adds two T-70 X-wings and an RZ-2 A-wing to your X-Wing collection, each sporting a new paint scheme based on their appearance in Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker. These ships are flown into battle by a slew of new pilots who are led into battle by an updated version of established Resistance ace and commander Poe Dameron.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Eta-2 Actis Expansion Pack
Description:
As the Clone Wars takes its toll on the ranks of the Jedi Order, those that remain must assume even greater responsibilities in the Grand Army of the Republic. The Eta-2 Actis-class Interceptor, developed by Kuat Systems Engineering, is stripped down so that battle hardened Jedi pilots can get the most out of its agile frame.

This expansion puts one of these agile ships as well as a Syliure-class Hyperspace Ring in your hands. Meanwhile, six ship cards offer an array of the galaxy's most notable Jedi Knights to fly it into battle and six upgrade cards invite you to customize the ship with a new astromech, additional Force abilities, and more!
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Nimbus-class V-Wing Expansion Pack
Description:
The Kuat Systems Engineering Alpha-3 Nimbus-class V-wing is the vessel of choice for the Galactic Republic’s clone and non-clone starfighter pilots alike. This nimble craft is fielded in various configurations for specialized tasks. The techniques pioneered to mass-produce its precision ion engines will later be crucial in the development of the TIE series by Sienar Fleet Systems.

The Nimbus-class V-Wing Expansion Pack contains everything you need to incporate one of these versatile starfighers into your Galactic Republic squadrons, including a beautifully pre-painted miniature and six ship cards that allow you to hand pick your pilot. Meanwhile, seven upgrade cards give you the freedom to customize your ship with new astromechs, two different configurations, and more!
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Droid Tri-Fighter Expansion Pack
Description:
Designed by the Colicoid Creation Nest and manufactured by Phlac-Arphocc Automata Industries, the heuristic processers of Droid Tri-Fighters allow these deadly ships to analyze and adapt to enemy tactics in-flight. Deployed late in the Clone Wars, these aggressive starfighters, and the destructive buzz droids they carry, pose a serious threat to even veteran Jedi pilots.

Within this expansion you'll find everything you need to add one of these aggressive droids to your Separatist squadrons, beginning with a beautifully detailed, pre-painted Droid Tri-Fighter miniature. This miniature is accompanied by six ship cards inviting you to choose a specific set of programming for it as well as seven upgrade cards that give you the freedom to outfit it with a variety of weapons, systems, and more.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Jango Fett's Slave I Expansion Pack
Description:
Originally produced for law enforcement purposes by Kuat Systems Engineering, the Firespray-class patrol craft is also a favorite of bounty hunters like Jango Fett, who use its robust chassis to add their own weaponry and modifications.

This expansion pack lets you put your personal touch on your own Firespray-class patrol craft painted in the colors of Jango Fett's Slave I. In addition to the miniature, you'll also find four ship cards in this expansion, including the infamous Jango Fett himself, along with 13 upgrade cards that let you customize your ship to fit your strategy.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: Armada – Separatist Alliance Fleet Starter
Description:
War! Commanded by the sinister Count Dooku, the Separatist Alliance has drawn numerous worlds into open insurrection against the Galactic Republic, spreading chaos and tyranny in the name of greed. With its powerful warships and vast reserves of droid forces, the Separatist fleet seems an insurmountable threat to peace and freedom in the galaxy.

This Fleet Starter provides the building blocks for your own Separatist fleet, starting with a Munificent-class Frigate miniature and two Hardcell-class Transport miniatures. These ships are supplemented by four squadrons of Vulture-class Droid Fighters ready to swarm their enemies. In addition to these miniatures, six ship cards give you the power to choose the exact models that make up your fleet and 20 upgrade cards invite you to fine-tune each ship with iconic officers, powerful weapons, and more.

No matter how you decide to outfit your fleet, the Separatist Alliance Fleet Starter is an excellent place to begin building your Star Wars: Armada collection. You’ll find all the components necessary to begin playing within this set, including nine attack dice, 10 command dials, eight speed dials, 12 objective cards, six obstacle tokens, a range ruler, and a maneuver tool. Assemble your fleet and destroy the enemy!

Name: Star Wars: Armada – Republic Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack
Description:
Devastate your opponent's squadrons with the speed and power of the Galactic Republic's fighter squadrons! Harness the agility of Delta-7 Aethersprites, bombard enemy captial ships with BTL-B Y-wings, control the battlefield with heavy ARC-170 Starfighters, and escort your forces with versatile V-19 Torrents.

All together, this expansion adds eight Republic fighter squadrons to your fleets, including seven elite pilots. Defend the Republic with the Republic Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack!

Name: Star Wars: Armada – Separatist Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack
Description:
Overrun your opponents with a full array of Separatist starfighters! This expansion puts droid fighters like Vulture droids, Hyena bombers, and Droid Tri-Fighters at your disposal. Meanwhile, your Belbullab-22 Starfighters can launch devastating attacks while screened by these disposable droids.

All told, this expansion adds eight Separatist fighter squadrons to your fleets, including six elite pilots. Take the power of these sinister pilots into your hands with the Separatist Fighter Squadrons Expansion Pack!

Name: DSbuilders
Description:
Our Emperor asked for new ways to spread terror through the sectors. He engaged the best scientists in the galaxy to design the definitive weapon to defeat the Rebellion: a massive Orbital Station...the Dark Star.

In DSbuilders, six Koenigs have six cycles to build the station while the galaxy is on fire and a riddle of unpredictable events influences the strategy to follow. If this scenario sounds familiar and you are an agilist, this is your game. The game is based on the assumption that all players have basic knowledge of Agile and Scrum, and a facilitator, like an experienced Agile Coach (or similar), is available.

In fact, DSbuilders is a team-based, co-operative, serious game on scaling agile teams across organization. The game is played by six teams, each of them with 1 to 8 players, and they have to build all systems of the Dark Star, the new weapon designed to conquer the galaxy.

The game takes place over six turns, and each turn the teams have to define their work (components to build) considering all constraints (capacity, integrations and dependencies). At the end of each turn, the Emperor (facilitator) defines the short term goal on the basis of the events happening in the galaxy.

If you fail to achieve any intermediate goal, game over!
If you fail to achieve the final goal, game over!
If you achieve the final goal, you conquer the galaxy!

Name: Agile SyS
Description:
As new Agile coach you are assigned to 5 squads that are in the middle of their journey to adopt agile.
You have to gain their Trust and increase their Motivation by investing your Time and your Portfolio of skills and tools to create a culture of Collaboration, Autonomy, Mastery and Purpose.

You have 6 months (12 sprints) to make this happen, while squads are facing Antipatterns and eventually Disruptions.

If the above scenario sounds familiar, this is your game. In fact Agile SyS, Support your Squads) is a solo serious game to simulate the difficulties in the journey to agility for a small team of teams and provide a list of possible solutions that could help the coach (here called “The Agent”, aka “agent of change”) to gain the trust of teams (here called “Squads”) he is working with.

Main goal of the Agent is to achieve highest level of trusts with squads while improving skills and tools that help also to face common wrong behaviours happening in squads. Time is the “money” of the game: player is often in the position not to have enough time to gain skills and tools, time to spend in actions, or time to achieve results, because the game ends in 12 rounds.

Agile Sys, has been designed in lockdown time for one player, however you can merge 2 or more decks and play the game with other Agents. This configuration is ideal to understand scaling in large organisation where different coaches are working together in the same program or business function.

Name: Wild Cats: Bonus Cats
Description:
More cats = more fun! The Fat Cat is the boss who steals all of the credit. The Cool Cat is too cool to play along. And the Smarty Cat knows more than anyone else!

A set of 3 extra roles for Wild Cats, to diversify and play up to 6 players: Fat Cat, Cool Cat and Smarty Cat.


This expansion is included in the Deluxe editions of the base game.


RULES

Fat Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie.
Reveal yourself before the vote.
You don't vote, but you still point. You steal the win if you point to the winning player.

Cool Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie.
You can't ask questions.
You do not vote. You win if no other player wins.

Smarty Cat
You MAY tell the truth or lie. At any time, reveal yourself, choose a player and look at their card.
You do not vote. You tie for a win if the player you chose loses.

Name: Crimibox: Dossier As
Description:
Solve your own murder mystery. With the help of a chat bot you investigate police files, photo's and evidence. Search the internet and use social media to unravel the secrets of your suspects.

When Antje van den Hoef suddenly died she left her loved ones and the police with a lot of unanswered questions. Why did she request to be cremated? Why did she already have an urn? And why was the urn already filled before her cremation?

There is no body. Only ashes. Hunt for the coldblooded murderer on the unlikely hunting grounds of the retirement home. A leopard never changes its spots. And despite all the false teeth, this monster still has all of them.

Some of the features included in this game:

     Analyse documents 
     Decipher secret codes
     Watch video footage
     Scour social media for clues


And much more!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Hatamoto: Rivals
Description:
In Hatamoto: Rivals, you play as one of legendary samurai Takeda Shingen's renowned 24 generals. From the 12 generals available to choose, each with his own unique ability, you must manage your province well enough to provide Shingen with the troops and supplies he demands for his war effort.

You can recruit Infantry and Cavalry, build more Rifles, and grow more Rice, but will it be enough for his next order? Pay your rival Hatamoto a small favor to make him more pliable, and then request help to fill Shingen's order for you this turn. But helping you gets him half your Honor reward...

Players must balance their own province's production with currying favor with their rival Hatamoto to fill as many of Shingen's requests as possible. Whichever Hatamoto ends the game with the most Honor will be named Shingen's next Taisho.

—description from the designer

Name: Thunderstone Quest: Miricelle's Return
Description:
The 11th quest for Thunderstone Quest heralds the epic return of Miricelle. It comes with 267 Cards, 24 Randomizers, 24 Dividers, 6 Dungeon Room Tiles, 1 Prestige Class Board and 1 Guardian board.

Miricelle's Return is part of The Enemies Among Us, a 2-Quest Kickstarter also featuring Darkness Rising.

Name: Confrontation
Description:
Confrontation is played with the 4-10 from two standard decks of cards. 13 cards are dealt to each player and the remaining 4 are discarded unseen. The players sit with partners across from each other.

On a turn a player plays a card to their team's area, either creating a new set or adding to an existing set. Sets can either be cards of the same number of cards of the same suit. If a set is ambiguous (e.g. any single card) it does not have to be declared. Once a set is unambiguous it is moved to the imaginary "confrontation line" between the two team's areas. A team may not have more than one of each kind of set.

Once all cards have been played any ambiguous sets are discarded and the rest are compared; the team with more cards in a set of given type gets the points for that type. Number sets are worth their printed value and suit sets are worth ten.

Name: Match Attax: UEFA Champions League – Season 2019/20
Description:
This is a 2019/2020 UEFA Champions League Match Attax card game, sealed display box contains 50 packs of 6 cards, for a total of 300 cards !
Become part of the biggest football competition in the world with this sensational card game from Topps, official 2019-20 UEFA Champions League. This product is loaded with the best stars of the UEFA Champions League.
Try cards from global superstars and childhood heroes like Ronaldo, Lionel Messi, Christian Pulisic, Neymar, Harry Kane, Robert Lewandowski, and many others.
One of the most popular soccer items every year, it makes a great gift and addition to every card collection.

Gameplay
Build your team - 11 players (1 goalie, 3 attackers etc...)
In 11 rounds you then have to beat your opponent by comparing the attack vs defense value of the 2 players selected.

Name: Cash Flow
Description:
Cash Flow uses a standard 52-card deck and a supply of money (points). Each player receives 30 points. The deck is shuffled and one card is turned up to start a row.

On a turn a player can choose to buy any number of cards from the row, including none. The card farthest from the deck costs ten, the next nine, and so on, with a minimum cost of one. Regardless of whether or not any cards were purchased a new card is drawn and placed at the end of the row.

The cards are used to form sets of the same suit or same rank. However, a suit set can only contain cards from 2-9 or J-A - the high and low cards cannot be mixed. A table of set values is provided. Before buying cards a player may sell any number of sets from their hand.

The game continues until the deck runs out and no players want to sell any sets or buy any cards.

Name: Soldatenspiel
Description:
The blue army (50 infantry and 12 cavalry) are positioned on 62 spaces near the mill, while the red army occupies 62 spaces near the farm on the other side of the river.

Movement in any direction is 6 spaces for the infantry or 10 spaces for the cavalry per turn. The player has to decide if he moves his infantry or cavalry.

The players try to take enemy pieces by enclose them so that they can't move. Enclosed troops are removed from the game.

The first player to take 10 enemy pieces wins the game

The 1933 edition of the game includes two expansions for advanced players: "Zeppelin and airplanes" and "Trenches".

—user summary

Name: Battle of the Nations 1813: Connewitz & Wachau
Description:
Expansion 1 (Connewitz) contains a rule (additional actions). The tiles that are needed to play the expansion are inside the base game.

Expansion 2 (Wachau) contains wooden figures (and a new rule). It allows to play the game with 3 players.

-description from designer

Name: Trolldilemma
Description:
In this fantasy card game, the players play troll bandits competing for the most COINs.

Each turn, a player reveals as many cards ('TRAVELLERS') as there are players. Each traveller has an initiative score and will be assigned to each player - the player with the most SKULLs (see below)receives the highest priority card, and so on.

Each TRAVELLER either gains or costs their player coins, or introduces a new mechanic into the game. The higher the priority, the higher the rewards of a TRAVELLER card, but the higher the chance the card will be negative for the player.

Before each card is assigned, players can assign SKULLs to other players, themselves, or no one at all. This happens simultaneously, and after the cards to be assigned cards have been revealed. I.e. if the highest card is costing you a lot of COIN, and you have the most or are tied for the most SKULLs, you will want to give your SKULL to another player and hope you won't get any more, so the highest priority, negative TRAVELLER card doesn't go to you. On the other hand, you don't want to have much less SKULLs as anybody else, as you will constantly miss the high COIN value TRAVELLERs.

There is also a randomised item shop where players can spend coin for one-time or permanent rule changes (redistributing or removing SKULLs, changing priorities, lessen the impact of negative TRAVELLERs, and so on).

The game ends if one player starts and ends a turn with eight or more skulls, as they get to much attention to stay robbing people.

-description from designer

Name: Artificial Life 101: Creating Monsters for Undergrad Students
Description:
Each player has to gather sets of resources to build a monster from fantasy or sci-fi as a semester thesis. They only have 15 days (rounds) left.

The players gain victory points by turning in sets of resources described by their thesis cards, which are unique to each player and to be kept secret as long as possible. Each thesis emphasises three of the five available resource categories: Science, Magic, Components, Flesh and Energy.

To gather resources, they have to build a laboratory which transform, splits or fuses resources or teleports them all over the place. The players vie for space and race against time to gather the right material in a chaotic card game with a modular playing field and engine-building elements.

Each turn consists of three phases: In the first phase a player adds a tile to or modifies a tile of their laboratory to give it more functions, like turning certain resources into others, duplicating resources or fusing certain resources into more resources of another kind. A smartly planned lab can set of chain reactions to create lots of the wanted resources from any kind of original resource.

In the second phase, they can choose to either feed a new, randomly determined resource into their lab, or let resources in the lab go into the next stage of a reaction.

In the third phase, they can turn in resources gathered in their lab for points or special action cards, which can help them or hinder other players through various bonuses. Turning in resources for points reveals a players thesis to other players, so they can better try to sabotage their labs.

After fifteen rounds, the player who turned in the most relevant sets for their thesis wins. There are multiple strategies to build a functioning lab with their own risks and rewards, and until the last turn there can often be dramatic changes in the score.

-description from designer

Name: The Suits: Ladies
Description:
Medieval knights clashed to prove their bravery, courage and to impress rich and (sometimes) beautiful women. The Middle Ages are a relict of the past, but men are still men afterall and they still want to prove their superiority. So, what is the most reliable and effective way to distinguish a nobleman from a peasant? Oh yes! Duel! Instead of wearing full plate armor they wear equally charming elegant suits. Instead of fighting on the tournament arena, they meet in the underground of secret club called The Suits. Join this elite society and fight for your prestige and ...........*

*) Enter your deepest and darkest desire that you want to fight for (or die for, but it wasn't in the agreement)

And remember that the first and last rule of The Suits Club is - you do not talk about The Suits Club.

This season is different. Why? Because this time female characters are entering to the club.

Each player controls one of five available characters. Each character has his own unique deck of cards. By using your wits, tactics, strategies and of course, a little bit of luck you can show your enemies who is the real gentleman. The Suits is a fast-paced, two-person card game steaming with atmosphere and tactical depth.

—description from the designer

Name: Le Torri di San Gimignano
Description:
San Gimignano is a small city in Tuscany, Italy famed for the 72 medieval towers built by families to exhibit their wealth and influence. In Le Torri di San Gimignano, a.k.a. ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ»ã‚¸ãƒŸãƒ‹ãƒ£ãƒ¼ãƒŽã®å¡”, each player represents a noble family in medieval Tuscany who is trying to build more towers that are higher and more beautiful than those of your rival.

Players start with five cards in hand and four cards in a face-up market from a deck that contains five 5s, six 6s, and so on to ten 10s. They draw and swap cards from an open market, looking to lay out cards of the same value (a plain tower) or of rising values in a run (a colorful tower). Players can add to existing towers, too. After building a plain tower, they receive a bonus effect (a donation) based on the rank of that tower. Players can complete towers by setting them aside as an action; they can no longer add to these towers, but each scores an additional 5 points at game's end.

In the final scoring, players score for having the highest tower, for plain towers that are taller than the opponent's tallest tower in the same rank, and for their colorful towers (# of towers x # of floors total in these towers). The player with the highest score wins.

The game also includes a set of noble cards for an advanced game, with the nobles having special effects in the game.

Name: Onkel Reje: Verdens største prut
Description:
Press the head of Onkel Reje, and he says what kind of food he wants you to give him. Press as many times as you want - but be careful, cause if he farts, you don't get to give him anything!
First player to deliver all his food tokens to Onkel Reje, wins the game.

The game includes a figure of Onkel Reje, the (in)famous character from Danish children's TV, that speaks (and farts) when you press him - a sure winner for children aged 5-8 years.

Name: The House and Temple Of The Flying Blades: 1st Dan Expansion
Description:
Ninja techniques have improved since the last skirmish. Now the dojos can use a new set of stealth movements and also a new weapon.

Also the House now has a few columns were the ninjas can hide behind.

This expansion works for any number of players (2-5).

-description from publisher

Name: Caverna: Frantic Fiends
Description:
Orcs are ravaging the lands and threatening your caves and families! Can you defeat the ravaging orcs and bring back peace and prosperity to your people?

In Caverna: Frantic Fiends, the second large expansion for Uwe Rosenberg's Caverna: The Cave Farmers, you have to face these hostile plunderers. Luckily, you can either use your proven axes to teach them a lesson or build traps to keep them away from the cave entrances altogether. You can even push them into these traps with stone or bribe them with wood to weaken their strength. Defeating orcs will bring precious rewards, but if you fail to drive them off, all your plans might be in jeopardy.

Name: 昆虫ゲッチュ！ (Catch the Bug!)
Description:
æ˜†è™«ã‚²ãƒƒãƒãƒ¥ï¼ (Catch the Bug!) is a game from Japan about kids out on a bug hunt.

Players place square cards on the table, building up a grid of bug cards and squads of kids hunting the bugs. When the tableau is complete, players score for the bugs they have secured.

Players try to get their kids to form intersects around some bugs. This means that only one squad can catch each bug.

The kids are ranked by their skills 1-3 with the older kids better more able, and the bugs are also valued 1-4 and -3. Kids can only catch insects if their individual or combined skills are equal or better than the wisdom of the elusive critters. Catching a risky insect like a hornet scores negative points. If multiple squads are competing, the squad with higher skills in total wins the insect.

As the grid develops, players can place good catches at their own kids, and bad catches onto their opponents. The game is quick and easy to play.

At the finish, the highest total score wins.
user summary

Name: ムーチョ de チョーショ (Mucho de Chosho)
Description:
ãƒ ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ§ de ãƒãƒ§ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ (Mucho de Chosho) is a party game from Japan.

One player ('parent') lays out four cards showing different themes or ideas about the person, and states how many of them are lies. The other players may ask questions, and after some deduction, they try to pick which card is a lie. If they get it correct, they score, but if they choose wrong, the parent scores a point.

The game is meant as a communication game, which is a very popular form of social game in Japan. The game works as an ice-breaker, and helps people talk about themselves.

The card text is all in Japanese.
user summary

Name: Polynesia: Expansion Map
Description: This expansion map provides a different configuration of routes for the base game, Polynesia.

Name: My First La Cucaracha
Description:
Unlike the original Kakerlakak game, Mein erstes Kakerlakak is aimed at very young players. The mama cockroach — that is, a HEXBUG — runs through a path that loops on the game board. At the start of a round, each player places one of their "food balls" (a colored marble) in the starting location, then you start mama on the path, with her ideally knocking your food through the holes in the path to feed the baby cockroaches that live in the floor. Whoever first has all their food delivered to the babies wins!

Mein erstes Kakerlakak includes a variant for slightly older children in which players try to collect an assortment of food colors to fill their basket first.

Name: Criss-Cross
Description:
Criss-Cross is a simple roll-and-write game for any number of players. Each player has a 5x5 grid of squares.

Each turn two standard dice are rolled and all players enter the sum in an empty box in their grid; 10, 11, and 12 are entered as 0, 1, and 2 respectively.

After 25 turns the grids are full and each player scores their rows and columns: 2/3/4/5 of the same number score 1/3/6/10 points, and 5 sequential numbers (not necessarily in order) scores 5 points. If a row or column contains multiple scoring combinations (two pairs or a pair and a triple) just add the scores for each combination.

The second version of the game (in Dice Games Properly Explained) gives a few variants:


     For larger groups it suggests entering two different numbers on each sheet to begin with and playing 23 turns.



     In Criss and Cross the rows and columns are totaled separately and you only score the lower of the two numbers.



     Criss versus Cross is for two players only; players use the same grid and take turns entering numbers. One player scores rows and the other columns.

Name: Ma Bell
Description: Dubbed as the "New Monopoly", Ma Bell is a Monopoly clone with few major differences. The game features cardboard counters depicting telephones as homage to the name (a nickname for Bell Telephone Co.) used as movers and property markers. The property spaces are named after spoofed titles of real stores and businesses of the late 1970s and early 1980s.

Name: Stop Gap
Description: A checkers-like game featured in the Quick Winner Family Fun Games line by Hasbro in the 1970s. The game features 48 checkers in orange and yellow. Players take turns filling in the board except for the center circle to set up. An extra checker is used to stack on one of your players to make an "officer". The ultimate goal of the game is to eliminate all of your opponents officers, or force them to be unable to take a move. Single checkers, or "guards" move one space and can either jump checkers to remove them, or move onto a friendly piece to form a new officer. Officers can move any number of spaces in a single direction, but can only remove other officers.

Name: Top the Top
Description: Players take turns trying to get 120 points to win the round or game. Featuring 3 different sized tops, 2 stands, a transfer arm, and 3 small crowns. On their turn, players spin the largest top on the scoring base and then must cap the top with a crown before spinning the next sized top on the spinning platform. Then, using the magnet in the transfer arm, players must get the top to spin on the crown of the previous top and repeat with the third top and final crown before the largest top stops spinning and dumps all of the pieces off. Each top and crown has a point value for the highest level the player achieves on their turn.

Name: Dutch Days
Description: A simple flip/roll and move game featuring a map of central/south Pennsylvania Dutch country. Produced in Glen Rock PA by Avalon Hill and sponsored by Heidi House. The game utilizes a deck of cards telling you how many spaces to move or roll after you read the fact or quote about the people and places of PA Dutch Country. Also included is a booklet of information and a recipe book that when referenced by a card allows special movement.

Name: Tiny Reef
Description:
The planet’s coral reefs are in danger and a group of biologists are taking action to protect them. On a mission to Tiny Reef, they take inventory of the reef animals to make it a sanctuary for marine life.

During a game of Tiny Reef, players draw on their sheet the marine animals they observe, following certain constraints. They earn points by forming groups of Marine animals of the same species and fulfilling some of the goals.

—description from the publisher

Name: 密林サーチ (Jungle Search)
Description:
å¯†æž—ã‚µãƒ¼ãƒ (Jungle Search) is a party game from Japan, with players searching online densely forested retailers (Amaz*n) to find items, and then guessing the most expensive.

Players draw cards with various themes, and players use the internet to search for items fitting the starting letters. Players work out which one costs the most to score points.

The game does require internet connection (not provided), but you do get a whiteboard and marker with eraser, and 45 theme cards.
user summary

Name: Swap
Description:
Swap is played with four standard dice and 12 chips in each of four colors. Players start with one chip of each color and the rest are placed in a row of supplies.

At the start of each round the dice are rolled and assigned to the chip supplies - the color on the left gets the highest die, the next color gets the second-highest, etc. Then each player in turn may trade; they can turn in chips to the supplies and take chips, but they must obey two rules: the total value of the chips taken cannot exceed that of those turned in, and at most one chip of each color can be traded.

After each round the start player moves. The winner is the first player to have two chips of each color. If playing solo the object is to reach this goal in as few turns as possible.

The book versions of the game include variants:


     In Sway Swap the dice are not rolled each round; instead they are rolled all together only at the start of the game. On a player's turn they choose a die to roll, after which they re-order the dice and then may trade.



     In Sellout the die rolling is handled as in Sway Swap, but it uses dice in colors matching the chips instead of ordering the dice. In this version the game continues until there is only one chip left in the market, at which point the player with the most chips wins.

Name: Cross Numbers Game
Description: Volume IV in one of the Russell little books card game sets. The game features a deck of cards split into four colored triangles with different numbers on them. The goal is to score enough points to win the game, and play your cards to end the round. On their turn players match the colored sides of the cards so that the numbers add to a multiple of 5 to score points, while matching multiple sides can give a bonus as in other domino-style games like Contack.

Name: Wild West Game
Description: Volume V in one of the Russell little books card game sets. A simple matching game using cards featuring various motifs of the old American "wild" west. Players take turns drawing cards in the aim to match pairs of cards and law down for points or hold for a gin-style hand. Players have an odd number of cards in their hands so that when all but 1 card is used in a pair that player can use the single card to end the round by calling "cowboy round-up" where hands are scored.

Name: Domino Cards
Description: Volume II in one of the Russell little books card game sets. It features a deck of cards depicting dual numbered dominoes and rules to play a number of basic domino games such as traditional dominoes, domino pairs, and Mexican Train.

Name: Spiria Material Card Game StA
Description:
Spiria Material Card Game StA is a 2 player card game from Japan, based off a previous trading card game called Spiria Material. This game allows players to begin playing in the Spiria Material world with only 5 hand cards each. The game includes just 18 cards for each player, so players can experience playing with a variety of combinations, without having to buy a whole deck of cards.
user summary

Name: Dragon Quest Trading Card Game
Description: A 2 player battling card game in the same vein as Pokemon or Magic the Gathering. A collectible trading card game published in Japan featuring many different sets of booster packs, starter decks, and collector's series of cards. The cards themselves depict monsters, bosses, and characters from the Dragon Quest/Dragon Warrior series of games split into 5 different color groups. Players use a deck of monsters and heroes to control the playing field with the help of item, event, and specialty cards as well.

Name: Rise N Fly
Description:
A trivia game where players try to score 7 points or avoid having 7 negative points. Players open each round by betting how many of 7 questions they can answer. The highest bidder wins or loses points based on their score. Featuring 4 categories, zinger cards for added gameplay, and features predominantly questions on African-American culture and history.

Can be played in teams.

Marked Olds Ogden & Johnson, Wilmington DE

Name: Snow White Game
Description: A simple roll and move children's game based on the Disney adaptation of Snow White & the Seven Dwarves. Players spin the spinner and move their Prince Charming token trying to meet up with the sleeping Snow White. The spinner also feature a magic mirror space, where players must use a small reflective space on the board to read the instructions on the backwards mirror cards.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White

Name: Dome Basketball Game
Description: Now you can play the excitement of the domed sports arcade games at home. Much like the more famous and popular domed rod/stick hockey, some arcades had push button domed sports like soccer, football, and basketball. This smaller tabletop version features 8 keys per side to pass, dribble, and shoot the ball down the court. Similar in play style to older sports games such as Bas-Kat by Cadaco. Different sports versions exist by a number of small companies, but the most prevalent seems to be by Hong Kong Toys made from the late 70s to early 90s.

Name: 2 in 1 Game Flipperz
Description: Produced by Majik Toys and East Point Sports, Game Flipperz is a double sided game board featuring action based sports games. One side features Pitch & Play Baseball which utilizes ringed marbles as in Rebound as baseballs and a pinball style bat to swing downfield. Players have plastic gates to simulate fielders to prevent the batting player from hitting into the slight wells to score runs. The other side of the board features Fling Football, a traditional paper football style game where players can block out 5 or 10 yard sections of the field with their defense tokens to make it more difficult for the offensive player to make it downfield. It also features a plastic catapult and foam football for kick-offs and field goals.

Name: Pods
Description:
Pods is an electronic tabletop game produced by Sega. The game features a three-piece console with dual-level light-up sensors and a central sensor with speakers and additional lights.

Pods feature rules for seven different games at three different skill levels, most of which deal primarily with speed or memory. The three sensors detect when a player puts their hand over them and responds by lighting up either the bottom half at a six-inch range or the top half around twelve inches. Each of the games utilized the lights or speakers in the central piece to direct players when and where to activate the sensors.

Name: Dilemma
Description:
Dilemma or Dubito is played with two or three decks of standard playing cards. Each player is dealt a hand of eight and the remainder form a draw pile.

On a turn, a player plays one card to their layout and then draws a replacement. A player's layout consists of four lines of cards:


    1. Cards that increase in value
    2. Cards in the same suit
    3. Cards in the same suit that increase in value
    4. Cards of the same rank


These lines are fixed at the start of the game (i.e. a player cannot play to a line and decide later which one it is.)

The game ends when no one can play any longer. Players score one point for each card in line 1, two for each in line 2, etc.

The book versions of the game (German and second English) suggest playing with two decks even with more players and also give some variants:


     In Subito a player may play multiple cards on their turn, replenishing only after all cards are played. (With two players use just one deck.)



     In Judico players do not have hands; instead on a turn a player draws a card and then may play it or discard it. Discarded cards are out of the game. The rules for the lines are relaxed in this version.

Name: Haunted: Get Scared to Death...Repeatedly!
Description:
Skeptical of the rumors, you and your friends decide to see if that creepy old house on the corner lives up to its reputation.

Finding yourselves locked inside with all manner of horrors, you must fight your way out before the house scares you and your friends to death.

Well, at least they’re your friends for now...

Gain and lose Courage Points as you wander through the house, encountering Scares while gaining protective Totems. But don’t worry, dying of fright isn’t the end. You’ll get to haunt the others to keep them from winning and possibly come back from the dead yourself.

Be the first player to gain all six Totems to beat the house and live to tell the tale!

Quick and easy to learn, light and fun highly competitive game.

This is a hand crafted game, made to order with high quality, durable acrylic components.

—description from the designer

Name: Operation Battleaxe
Description:
August, 1941. Rommel has driven the Western Desert Force all the way across Cyrenica. But the Tiger Convey has just arrived bringing tanks, airplanes, ammunition and supplies. General Wavell now has what he need to drive the Germans back, and seize initiative on the North African front.

The Player who best executes combined arms stands the best chance - you need to integrate all aspects of the North African Desert Space. The game is played in alternating turns. Each players forces will be under double digits as this is tactical game that includes basics like Line of Sight, Elevation, Opportunity Fire, Indirect Fire and armor overruns!

Operation Battleaxe is the third of Dark City Game's Combat Boots series of tactical wargames. Each piece is a squad or section of infantry, an individual vehicle, gun, or aircraft. The scale of the board is 50 meters per hexagon, and each game turn covers only a few minutes.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Unsullied Swordmasters
Description:
The Unsullied have one of the most difficult training regimens of any unit. Only about one in three survives to the end. However, those that do are swordsmen of unparalleled skill. Though they look slight compared to most western swordsmen, that does not mean they’re not as strong or effective on the battlefield. When joined with an officer, their skills are only enhanced, trading blow-for-blow with any foe.

The Unsullied Swordsmen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Targaryen players an effective melee unit on the field. Their melee attacks hit at the weak points in enemy armor, granting numerous bonuses when they strike. The Officer Unit Attachment adds to their strengths, trading wounds with the enemy when being attacked, making this unit able to dish out wounds both when attacking and on the defensive.

Contents:
13 Miniatures
  â€£ 1 Officer
  â€£ 11 Swordmasters
  â€£ 1 Swordmaster Bannerman
1 Unit Card
1 Attachment Card
1 Movement Tray
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Mother of Dragons
Description:
The Targaryen faction is almost defined by their unique relationship with dragons as both living war machines and companions. This miniatures set brings the Mother of Dragons, Daenerys Targaryen, to the battlefield accompanied by her young dragons. The dragon units will feature the unique ability to fly over other units as well as breathe fire onto their enemies.

The game box includes a Daenerys Targaryen miniature, 3 juvenile dragon miniatures, and character and tactics cards.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Unsullied Pikemen
Description:
Adding fearsome weapons to the unshakable Unsullied makes for a truly unbreakable center to any formation. Despite their armor rating a "light" classification in the western sense, and Unsullied spear wall, advancing in lockstep according to doctrines laid down in the Old Empire of Ghis, can move on virtually any position without fear of counterattack from the flanks or even the rear. While such a formation might seem immune to cavalry, a commander would be wise not to let them march forth unsupported, but if any unit can weather a short-term encirclement, it's the Unsullied Pikemen.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
  â€£ 12 Unsullied Pikemen
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: The Fifth Column
Description:
The Fifth Column is a precursor of Schotten Totten played with a standard deck of cards. In the basic version each player gets a hand of six cards and two rows of nine cards each are placed on the table to start the players' columns. Two cards are discarded and the rest form a draw pile.

On a turn a player plays to one of their nine columns, claims columns if possible, and draws a card. The three-card column sets are ranked from straight flush down. A column can be claimed even if the opponent's set is incomplete if you can prove there is no way they can beat your set. If a column is completed on both sides and is tied, the player who played last loses it.

The object is to claim five columns.

Some variants are given:


     Ignore straights and straight flushes.



     Each player gets 15 cards at the start and never draws any more.



     Don't place any cards in the columns initially, as in the later game.

Name: Region
Description:
The war of the kings is almost over, and few are left alive to win it for the them. The last hope for each side is on the way, but each of them has to hold their ground until their fierce commander arrives. Who can conquer this ever-shifting terrain and not fall victim to their own moves?

In Region, players maneuver their king on the grid to claim free spaces and take back the enemy-occupied spaces by surrounding them, while trying not to be encircled by the enemy. After placing their fifth conquest tile, players can enter their commander into the game. While more powerful, commanders are more restricted in their movement, yet they can turn the tide of the game.

The first player to place all of their tiles wins.

Name: Elementra: Dragon Academy
Description:
Welcome to the world of Elementra. In this fast-paced game, players take on the roles of Elementra students in their first year of training - learning how their powers work in combination with their dragon companions.

Use your abilities, strategy, and luck to create the most powerful duo of dragon and rider you can to defeat all other challengers.

Name: Limelight
Description:
Limelight is played on a 4x4 grid with the corners cut off using pieces in two colors. White plays first and has 11 pieces, black has 10.

On a turn a player enters a piece on one of the edge spaces, pushing a piece there to the next space and so on. However, pieces may not be pushed off the board.

When all pieces have been played the board will be full. The player with the most pieces in the nine central squares wins.

The game can be played on a larger board with more pieces. If the center region has an even number of spaces and the players tie, the first player wins.

Name: Temples
Description:
An unavoidable calamity has fallen upon earth, and there is no place to take shelter from the wrath of gods. It's been ages since the last temple was seen. You are summoned as the most adept sorcerers in the world to try building the last temple while competing for the favor of gods — but this is no easy task. You have to build it block by block, infusing each block with magic and hoping that it can withstand what is yet to come.

In Temples, the layout of the game consists of a variable arrangement of block cards in the form of a temple, with each block having a number. You try to play cards with a total equal to the number of each block to either:


    Add blocks with larger numbers to your hand, or
    Claim the building blocks of the temple and increase your score.


The game ends once every block of the temple has been claimed. Whoever has the most claimed blocks is the most renowned sorcerer and wins.

Name: Anno 1800: The Power of Gold Mini-Expansion
Description:
Macht des Goldes ("Power of Gold") is a mini-expansion consisting of new assignment cards that give new options for gaining and spending gold. It consists of two new assignment cards:

     Dr. Hugo Mercier, who allows players to avoid getting new population cards by spending gold.
     Lady Margaret Hunt, who gives players gold when they tear down a building.


—user summary

Im großen Aufbau-Strategie-Spiel baut jeder Spieler kontinuierlich die eigene Industrie auf, um seine Heimatinsel weiterzuentwickeln. Mit dieser Mini-Erweiterung „Macht des Goldes“ könnt ihr mehr Abwechslung in eure Anno 1800 Partien bringen. Diese Auftragskarten bieten euch neue Möglichkeiten, Gold zu verdienen und auszugeben.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trading Places
Description:
Trading Places is a trivia game with a theme of traveling around the world attempting to complete business contracts. Money is awarded for this and the winner is the first player to accumulate a million pounds.

Movement is controlled by three dice which determine mode of travel (air, sea, etc.) and other details. While traveling players may answer "En Route" questions to continue. Entering cities requires answering more difficult "Visa Entry" questions and the "Contract Completion" questions are the most difficult.

Some travel spaces have limited capacity so players may have to answer "Challenge" questions to bump other players out.

The En Route and Challenge questions are general knowledge; the Visa Entry questions are more travel-oriented and the Contract Completion questions more business-oriented.

Name: Eintracht Frankfurt Quiz
Description:
Eintracht Frankfurt Quiz
A combination of card and dice game containing 244 questions and 976 answers, in 6 difficulty levels.

Rules:
The youngest player begins. if he rolls a 2, the player to his left read out question 2 and the four possible answers on the back. If his answer is correct, he receives 2 victory points.
If he threw a 3, he would be asked the question 3. For the correct answer he would receive 3 victory points. And so on.

Each player only answers one question. 
Then it is the turn of the next player.

The winner is the first player to reach 50 points (or whatever victory conditions players agree upon)

Name: Spot On
Description:
Spot On requires a selection of cards from two standard decks: 3 black cards of each value from 3-9 and 12 red court cards. Players also each need a pawn and 12 counters in their color; one side of each counter needs to be marked with a spot.

The cards are shuffled and laid face-up in a 6x6 grid. On a turn a player places their pawn next to a row or column and rolls the die. They count that many cards from the pawn and place a counter on it, spot up, placing on top of an opposing counter if necessary. If necessary the count wraps around to the start of the row/column.

The player may then roll again and place another counter. This continues until they decide to stop or they roll a card which they already have a counter on (from this or a previous turn). In the latter case all the counters they placed this turn are removed. Otherwise they flip over their just-placed counters, remove any opposing counters from these cards, and take any of these cards that are courts. If they have counters on all three black cards of a given number they take those as well.

The game ends when all court cards have been taken. Each set of black cards is worth the cards' number. Each court is a point unless a player has seven or more, which is worth 12 points.

Name: Ecos: New Horizon
Description:
Now your expanding continent can include iconic landscape features! Add Kilimanjaro, the Sahara, Serengeti, and others to your developing world. And of course, there are more animals to increase the population of your ecosystem - from Nile Crocodiles to herds of Zebra. New Horizon introduces a new type of card mechanic to play these landscape features, and each interacts with the landscape in a unique way that will affect all players’ choices throughout the game. Can your plans withstand the creeping expansion of the Sahara or benefit from the deep jungle of the Congo Basin?

—description from the designer

Name: The Little Flower Shop: Basket – Game Boy Geek promo card
Description:
Promotional basket card offered during the Game Boy Geek - Season 8 - 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

This new basket card allows you to gain $2 and draw a random card.

Name: Subbuteo Shuffle Card Game
Description:
Subbuteo Shuffle Card Game


     Pass the ball from player to player by matching the balls on the cards, then shoot for goal! 


The first team to score three goals wins

     Includes 45 Player Cards, 6 Goalie Cards and 1 Coin Card 


Rules:
1. Pick up your four Players. 
2. Work out how many Players you can play in a horizontal line (your ‘pass line’) on the table in front of you. (You can only play a card if the ball on it matches the position(s) of the ball(s) on the card(s) next to it ) when two Player cards are played next to each other, they make a complete ball.. 
3. If you can play one, two or three Players to start your pass line, do that. If you’re able to play all four Players, only play three onto the table and skip to the Shoot for Goal! 
4. At the end of your turn, pick up new cards from your Players pile so that you’re holding four again. Play switches to the other team. Continue taking turns until you can play your fifth Player card into your pass line, It’s time to Shoot for Goal!
